name: flutter_test.TestTextInput

events.name: onCleared
events.desc:
Called when the keyboard goes away.

To use the methods on this API that send fake keyboard messages (such as updateEditingValue, enterText, or receiveAction), the keyboard must first be requested, e.g. using WidgetTester.showKeyboard.

methods.name: TestTextInput
methods.desc:
Create a fake keyboard backend.

The onCleared argument may be set to be notified of when the keyboard is dismissed.

methods.name: enterText
methods.desc: Simulates the user typing the given text.
methods.example:
Implementation

void enterText(String text) {
  updateEditingValue(TextEditingValue(
    text: text,
  ));
}

methods.name: hide
methods.desc: Simulates the user hiding the onscreen keyboard.

methods.name: receiveAction
methods.desc: Simulates the user pressing one of the TextInputAction buttons. Does not check that the TextInputAction performed is an acceptable one based on the inputAction setClientArgs.
methods.example:
Implementation

Future<void> receiveAction(TextInputAction action) async {
  return TestAsyncUtils.guard(() {
    // Not using the `expect` function because in the case of a FlutterDriver
    // test this code does not run in a package:test test zone.
    if (_client == 0) {
      throw TestFailure('Tried to use TestTextInput with no keyboard attached. You must use WidgetTester.showKeyboard() first.');
    }

    final Completer<void> completer = Completer<void>();

    BinaryMessages.handlePlatformMessage(
      SystemChannels.textInput.name,
      SystemChannels.textInput.codec.encodeMethodCall(
        MethodCall(
          'TextInputClient.performAction',
          <dynamic>[_client, action.toString()],
        ),
      ),
      (ByteData data) {
        try {
          // Decoding throws a PlatformException if the data represents an
          // error, and that's all we care about here.
          SystemChannels.textInput.codec.decodeEnvelope(data);

          // No error was found. Complete without issue.
          completer.complete();
        } catch (error) {
          // An exception occurred as a result of receiveAction()'ing. Report
          // that error.
          completer.completeError(error);
        }
      },
    );

    return completer.future;
  });
}

methods.name: register
methods.desc: Installs this object as a mock handler for SystemChannels.textInput.

methods.name: unregister
methods.desc:
Removes this object as a mock handler for SystemChannels.textInput.

After calling this method, the channel will exchange messages with the Flutter engine. Use this with FlutterDriver tests that need to display on-screen keyboard provided by the operating system.

methods.name: updateEditingValue
methods.desc: Simulates the user changing the TextEditingValue to the given value.
methods.example:
Implementation

void updateEditingValue(TextEditingValue value) {
  // Not using the `expect` function because in the case of a FlutterDriver
  // test this code does not run in a package:test test zone.
  if (_client == 0)
    throw TestFailure('Tried to use TestTextInput with no keyboard attached. You must use WidgetTester.showKeyboard() first.');
  BinaryMessages.handlePlatformMessage(
    SystemChannels.textInput.name,
    SystemChannels.textInput.codec.encodeMethodCall(
      MethodCall(
        'TextInputClient.updateEditingState',
        <dynamic>[_client, value.toJSON()],
      ),
    ),
    (ByteData data) { /* response from framework is discarded */ },
  );
}

props.name: editingState
props.desc:
The last set of arguments that TextInputConnection.setEditingState sent to the embedder.

This is a map representation of a TextEditingValue object. For example, it will have a text entry whose value matches the most recent TextEditingValue.text that was sent to the embedder.

props.name: isRegistered
props.desc:
Whether this TestTextInput is registered with SystemChannels.textInput.

Use register and unregister methods to control this value.

props.name: isVisible
props.desc: Whether the onscreen keyboard is visible to the user.

props.name: setClientArgs
props.desc: Arguments supplied to the TextInput.setClient method call.

desc:
A testing stub for the system's onscreen keyboard.

Typical app tests will not need to use this class directly.

See also:

  • WidgetTester.enterText, which uses this class to simulate keyboard input.
  • WidgetTester.showKeyboard, which uses this class to simulate showing the popup keyboard and initializing its text.
